title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
Hi

I am going to upgrade the SSD to 512GB

It came 4 NAND IC

U8600
U8700
U8800
U8900

Since there is no BRD file for this board I am not sure the location of the IC

Watching the video below I found 86 and 87. Can you give tell me which one goes besides 86 and 87 they are on different sides of the board!

[MEDIA=youtube]a5ZbVMHBSdM:223[/MEDIA]

After replacing the NAND IC I need to do DFU restore and reinstall the system right? Or do I need any other procedure after it?

Thank you very much!

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
Machine should automatically start in Recovery mode, after NANDs have been changed.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zwPyVAHXGbyDqLpDtYN6BXburO_KniXp/view?usp=share_link[/URL]

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
Changed all the NAND. I think I did a good job soldering it..

However now machine does not start

Tried to go put into DFU

Not a single behavior from the machine

Went to remove all the NAND and solder back only U8600 and U8700 on the board... still no behavior at all

It doesn't turn on anymore
No DFU 

To be honest I was really careful soldering the NANDS

Could I have touched a cap with that battery flex cable and shorted it? that's the only thing I am thinking about

OR 

Without the NAND properly soldered the machine will not have any beavhior?

Using amp meter it gets 20.15V with MagSafe connected and cable to another working macbook it goes to 5.20v without battery and 4.10V with battery connected

I am kind of LOST now!

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
Probably the heat applied on the board affected something else.
Or you have some knocked off component.

Check at least AWAKE, SLPS2R, SSD and G3S volatges if present.

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
I used 410C/65 on a Quick 861DW which I am used to solder all the other components also

Actually I knocked CD545 when lifting the NAND and the ground pad broke. I am trying to turn on the machine without it and I do think only without this guy it should turn on... Shouldn't it?

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
I put back CD545 now and same behavior.

Seriously i don't think I knocked anything else

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message: I am trying to turn it on with a few flex cables connected... Is there any relevant to make the machine turn on (I am using screen, touchbar, keyboard, trackpad, fan)

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
AWAKE
PP1V2_AWAKE = 1.2V
PP1V8_AWAKE = 1.8V
PP3V3_AWAKE = 3.3V

SLPS2R
PP0V8_SLPS2R = 0.8V
PP1V1_SLPS2R = 1.1V
PP1V8_SLPS2R = 1.8V

SSD
PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 = 2.5V

G3S
P1V8G3S_EN = 1.8V
P3V3G3S_EN = 1.8V (IS IT WRONG? I MEASURE ON R8200) 
PP1V8_G3S = 1.8V

This machine is auto power on if I plug on the magsafe without the battery connected?

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
Board should automatically turn on when charger is plugged in.
Test it alone on the desk, only charger connected.
Do you get voltage on big coils?

If you had working machine, which stopped working after you've worked on the MLB, you did something wrong; don't you think?
You must assume the risk, when try such kind of upgrade.
Recommend to the clients to sell and buy the machine they need, instead of upgrading onboard SSD/RAM.

message:
Yes all the measurement above I did with the board alone and charger connected

BIG COILS

L7030 is kind of crazy it goes to 8.75 and then 11v and things like
L7670 have 5V in one pin

As I said I did really careful the NAND soldering. I think when managing to put back that small battery flat MAYBE i touched components on the back side of the board when putting the board on its place.

Do you think touching something with that flat cable could damage something or could it be impossible?


Yes if the machine should turn on even I didnt soldered well the NAND of course I did something but I talking to heat I did it enough to solder to the board and actually MACBOOK boards are heat resistant way better than iPhone boards for example

I always assume the risk in cases like that.

Looking to solve it!

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
That flex has no voltage on it from battery side.
Battery is not enabled until the flex is inserted into MLB.
The problem is somewhere else.

MLB has all voltages to enter DFU.
Try to force it with SE032.
You can also try flashing U4770.

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
Awesome to hear that!

However how to force it with SE032. Can you give me more details never did this.

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
Solder wire on SE032 and connect charger.
After few seconds, when/if appears in AC2 (DFU, or Recovery mode) cutt of the wire.

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
T2 has a dedicated partition into SSD.
How can it start, without NANDs?

I told people on the forum many times, STOP checking L7030 voltage on new boards; is irrelevant measurment.

Without them it will be easier to check what could I have done to make the machine NOT turn on at all right?

I didnt know about L7030 on new boards. First time working with a model like this one.

THEN

I remove the original nand without breaking any pad, I guess I did it right, I only knock the cap CD545 and put back it in place.

Wihout CD545 would the machine turn on?? i think gnd pad broke and maybe CD545 is not properlly connected to the board

Beyond that I think everything was done as usual

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
Do you really think that using bold letters and quoting last post helps???

To boot, a machine MUST complete first the power on sequence (POS).
Machine turned on doesn't mean is booted always; just stays on.
PLT_RESET_L goes high when POS is done.

To complete POS, T2 requires to run its dedicated software LOCATED INTO HIDDEN SSD PARTITION.
Be aware, SMC functions are now embedded into T2.
How could this be possible, if no NANDs soldered on the board???

If still not clear, you are free to ask more. I still recommend you to check POS; available for 820-01055 and 820-01598 boards.

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
CD545 is not critical.
Just be sure the trace for PPVCC0_ANI_SSD0 is not broken.

If machine doesn't work with original NANDs, this confirms that something else happended on the MLB.
Did you try again DFU mode?

removed CD454 which has GND pad broken on the board itself

Still no behavior at all

What can I do from now?

I dont think I heat too much the board.
The only thing I knocked as mentioned was that cap which is not critical
Can't think about another thing

How could I break this trace PPVCC0_ANI_SSD0? Should I look on the components itself on the board?

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
No idea if that rail is broken.
I mentioned it just because you've said to found a damaged cap on that line.

If you don't find any damaged component, or trace, what else apart of heat can cause the problem?

Your board doesn't boot, no CPU voltages.
There is no reason to search PLT_RESET_L.

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
Possibly internal board damage.
There are very tiny traces going to T2.

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade
message:
If nothing else of NAND chips is damaged on the board, machine MUST enter DFU at least.
Try to understand, something else got damaged on the board.

In case like this, bad solders, broken trace/pads, knocked off components are classic things to check.
Hoping no other components have been affected.

T2 gets all voltages required to enter DFU?

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade

I repeat, machine was working; something happended in the NANDs change process.
If all components are in place and good solders, I can only suspect board internal damage.
Or some other chip damaged by heat.

As it doesn't go into DFU, T2 is also suspect now.
Did you try correctly to enter DFU?
[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/DFU_Mode_Restore_(Macs)[/URL]

title: 820-001598 SSD Upgrade

Possibly got bad NANDs, or you didn't solder them in the correct place.
If you have stock of scrap boards, then buy P13 programmer and prepare yourself the NANDs extracted from these boards.
